text: Great joining @Avik on @FREOPP’s American Wonk podcast to discuss what Congress has done to combat the Coronavirus, what more can be done, and much more. Thanks for having me on! https://t.co/5yJhhCwoXa

This is an unprecedented crisis that will require unprecedented action. But that doesn’t mean we can allow the relief package to become an Easter basket full of carveouts for corporate & special interests. In this bill we have to put small businesses & vulnerable Americans first.

3) A focus on community banks. In 2008, one idea that worked was allowing the FDIC to extend unlimited insurance for transaction accounts. This helped prevent a run on small banks and sent a badly needed message that money is safe with local lenders. We should replicate that now.

2) Immediate and sustained aid to the most vulnerable among us. Paid sick leave is great, but the process is convoluted and doesn’t help those getting laid off. We need to get checks to working Americans now and expand unemployment insurance programs for those who need them.

1) A loan program that provides immediate relief to small businesses. These would be paid over a long-term period at 0% interest and allow businesses to delay initial payments up to 3 months, giving employers access to the cash they need to get through the worst of this crisis.

THREAD ➡️ As we consider a massive stimulus plan, our priority needs to be helping working families and small businesses navigate these difficult times. That will require bold action, and while there is much to address, here are 3 ideas I think could go a long way in helping NEW.

Bottom line: mobile testing will play a huge part in helping us avoid overloading our hospital system. But this doesn’t mean everyone should get tested. We still can’t process massive amounts of tests, so call your doctor first and follow the steps above if you have symptoms. https://t.co/xQgAtlczAp

The idea is that if you have symptoms, you should: 

1. Call your doctor to see if you should get a test
2. Schedule an appointment if so
3. Drive up and get tested
4. Drive home and continue to self-quarantine 

More info on who to call here: https://t.co/FWQCFoirbg
